questions.question: I am thinking ……………………………. a business.
questions.description: The verb is followed by of + ing form.

questions.question: I stopped her …………………………….. my room.
questions.description: Stop is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: They encouraged me …………………………… again.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by object + to infinitive.

questions.question: I am tired …………………………… to advice.
questions.description: Tired is followed by of + ing form.

questions.question: I saw them …………………………….. in the garden.
questions.description: The see can be followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I was made …………………………….. the whole story.
questions.description: When make is used in the passive form, it is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Harsh punishments may deter potential offenders ………………………….. a crime.
I was not allowed …………………………..
questions.description: Allow is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The illness prohibited her …………………………. blood.
questions.description: Prohibit is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: We could not restrain him ………………………………… us.
questions.description: Restrain is followed by object + from + ing form.
